meanings.definition: A person who deceives or tricks others.
meanings.sent1: The beguilers in the story were always trying to trick the main character.
meanings.sent2: She was known as one of the most skilled beguilers in the town.
meanings.sent3: The beguilers at the magic show made everyone believe they could disappear.
meanings.sent4: The beguilers of the forest seemed to blend in with the shadows, deceiving all who passed by.
meanings.sent5: The beguilers wore masks to hide their true intentions, fooling even the wisest of villagers.

meanings.sent1: The mirror was a beguiler, showing a distorted reflection of reality.
meanings.sent2: The beguilers of the desert were the mirages that led travelers astray.
meanings.sent3: The beguiler of the puzzle box was the false bottom that hid the treasure.
meanings.sent4: The beguiler of the night sky was the false star that led sailors off course.
meanings.sent5: The beguiler of the carnival game was the rigged ring toss that tricked many into thinking they could win.
